Lack of credible sources: The expert points out that the quote attributed to former President Donald Trump cannot be traced back to any news reports or videos of him. This absence of credible sources raises doubts about the authenticity of the claim.
Absence of media coverage: The expert mentions that if the quote were genuine, it would have likely received significant media coverage, considering its relevance to the impeachment trial. The lack of such coverage further questions the veracity of the claim.
Admission of a joke: The author of the tweet containing the alleged quote, @PAULUSV3, admitted that it was just a joke. This admission undermines the credibility of the claim and suggests that it was not intended to be taken seriously.
Trump: s spokesperson's statement: Jason Miller, a spokesperson for former President Trump, stated that he would not testify in an unconstitutional proceeding. This statement contradicts the claim that Trump expressed a willingness to testify if he could travel on Air Force One, adding to the skepticism surrounding the authenticity of the claim.
